episodeTitle: A Major Turnaround! Luffy's Angry Iron Fist Strikes!
episodeTitleJapanese: 大逆転！炸裂ルフィ怒りの鉄拳
episodeTitleRomanized: Dai-gyakuten! Sakuretsu Rufi Ikari no Tekken
description: Law reveals the weakness of Breed's mind control ability, allowing the Straw Hats to turn the tables. Luffy teams up with the Kung-fu Dugong to defeat Breed and free the enslaved Sea Animal Pirates. The episode concludes with shocking news about Doflamingo's resignation from the Shichibukai reaching the Thousand Sunny.

events.title: Law Reveals Breed's Weakness
events.description: Law explains that Breed's Peto Peto no Mi control only works if the victim can actually hear his voice commands. He reveals that he and Luffy used earplugs to pretend being controlled while planning their escape.
events.significance: This revelation is the turning point that allows the Straw Hats to defeat Breed and free all the enslaved animals.

quotes.text: The victims must be able to hear and comprehend the command for it to take effect.
quotes.speaker: Law
quotes.context: Law explaining Breed's Devil Fruit weakness to the crew

events.title: Breed Uses Power on Himself
events.description: In a desperate move, Breed uses the Peto Peto no Mi on himself to enhance his own physical strength and muscle mass. However, this causes him to lose control over his enslaved animals.
events.significance: Breed's self-enhancement becomes his downfall, as he loses control of his 'pets' who then turn against him.

events.title: Enslaved Animals Break Free
events.description: The Sea Animal Pirates and other enslaved creatures break free from Breed's control and work together to hold him down, preventing him from issuing further commands.
events.significance: The animals' willpower overcomes Breed's control, showing that his power has limits when victims resist together.

events.title: Luffy and Kung-fu Dugong Defeat Breed
events.description: Luffy and the Kung-fu Dugong deliver a combined powerful punch to Breed, sending him flying and decisively ending the battle. This frees all the animals from his control permanently.
events.significance: Marks the conclusion of the Caesar Retrieval Arc and the defeat of its main antagonist. Also represents Luffy's reunion and teamwork with an old friend from Alabasta.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy teaming up with the Kung-fu Dugong for the final attack

events.title: Caesar Clown Recaptured
events.description: With Breed defeated, the Straw Hat-Heart alliance successfully recovers Caesar Clown, allowing them to continue with their plan to take down Doflamingo and Kaido.
events.significance: Ensures the alliance's plan can proceed, maintaining the leverage needed against Doflamingo.

events.title: Parting with the Sea Animal Pirates
events.description: Luffy says farewell to the Kung-fu Dugong and the newly freed Sea Animal Pirates. The animals express gratitude and continue their own journey, now free from Breed's control.
events.significance: A heartfelt reunion and farewell between Luffy and the Kung-fu Dugong he met during the Alabasta arc, showing how his influence inspired them to become pirates.

events.title: News of Doflamingo's Resignation Reaches the Sunny
events.description: Back on the Thousand Sunny, the crew receives shocking news via newspaper that Donquixote Doflamingo has resigned from his position as a Shichibukai. This development has massive implications for the world and Law's plan.
events.significance: This is a world-shaking event that sets up the Dressrosa arc. Doflamingo's resignation from the Shichibukai is part of his manipulation and creates chaos in the New World.

quotes.text: The victims must be able to hear and comprehend the command for it to take effect.
quotes.speaker: Law
Luffy
quotes.context: Teaming up with Kung-fu Dugong for the final attack

themes.description: The episode explores themes of freedom and autonomy as Breed's forced control over living beings is challenged and ultimately broken by willpower and teamwork.
themes.symbolism: The green collars represent slavery and loss of free will, while their breaking symbolizes liberation.

themes.description: Luffy's reunion with the Kung-fu Dugong shows how his influence inspires others to pursue their dreams, even years later.
themes.symbolism: The Kung-fu Dugong becoming a pirate captain mirrors Luffy's own journey and demonstrates the lasting impact of their Alabasta encounter.

themes.description: Law's strategic thinking in discovering Breed's weakness proves more valuable than raw power, emphasizing the importance of tactics in battle.
themes.symbolism: The earplugs represent cunning and preparation overcoming seemingly invincible abilities.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy reunites with an old friend from Alabasta and defeats Breed through teamwork, showing his growth while maintaining his core values of freedom and friendship.
keyActions: Works with Law to escape Breed's control
Teams up with Kung-fu Dugong for the final attack
Defeats Breed with a combined punch
Says farewell to the Sea Animal Pirates

characterSpotlights.development: Law demonstrates his analytical abilities by identifying Breed's weakness and pretending to be controlled while planning their escape.
keyActions: Pretends to be under control while planning escape
quotes: The victims must be able to hear and comprehend the command for it to take effect.

characterSpotlights.development: Breed's arrogance and over-reliance on his Devil Fruit power leads to his downfall when he uses it on himself and loses control of his enslaved army.
keyActions: Uses Devil Fruit power on himself for enhancement
Defeated by Luffy and Kung-fu Dugong

characterSpotlights.development: The Kung-fu Dugong has grown significantly since Alabasta, now leading his own pirate crew and having learned Armament Haki.
keyActions: Teams up with Luffy for the finishing blow
Departs to continue his own pirate journey

mangaDifferences.difference: The entire Caesar Retrieval Arc (episodes 626-628) is anime-original filler content and does not appear in the manga.
Breed, the Peto Peto no Mi, and the entire conflict with the Sea Animal Pirates are anime-only additions.
The news of Doflamingo's resignation happens in the manga between chapters 699-700, though the circumstances around receiving it differ from this filler arc.

trivia.fact: This is the final episode to use 'Hands Up!' by Kōta Shinzato as the opening theme in the original Japanese broadcast.
The Caesar Retrieval Arc is the eleventh filler arc in One Piece and the second filler arc after the time skip.

sources.title: Caesar Retrieval Arc - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: The Kung-fu Dugong that appears in this arc is the same one that Luffy befriended during the Alabasta arc, showing continuity with episodes 92-93.

sources.title: Sea Animal Pirates - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: An animation error in this episode misspelled Scratchmen Apoo's name as 'Scratcimen' in the newspaper imagery.
The Kung-fu Dugong learned to use Armament Haki during the timeskip, making him one of the few filler characters to demonstrate this advanced ability.

sources.title: Sea Animal Pirates - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: Breed's plan involved using SMILE fruits to turn humans into animals so he could control them with his Peto Peto no Mi, connecting this filler arc to the main storyline's artificial Devil Fruits.
